prs.title: 🪲 hyperliquid - skip fork tests when failed vm.createFork()
prs.truncated_body:
Since hyperliquid's testnet rpc goes down at times, this causes our CI to fail. A temporary solution before 
we can migrate forking to mainnet rpc - which is considerably more stable (needs hyperliquid to enable write precompiles and we will use a core spot deployed by someone else) 

I would rather not use `deployCodeTo` since `etch` is more meant for precompiles.

commits.message:
op-acceptance-tests: interop: load test: add basic metrics collection

Metrics:
- In-flight messages
- AIMD scheduler RPS (interpreted as the target messages per block time)
- Actual message rates by status (success, init\_failed, exec\_failed)

Generate time-series graphs for all metrics and save graphs as timestamped
PNG files in the `artifacts` directory

Eventually, we may want to replace the hand-crafted visualizations with
an external prometheus+grafana dependency. This will likely require deeper
integration with `op-devstack` so we reserve it for future work.

To run the test:

```
NAT_INTEROP_LOADTEST_TARGET=500 go test -v -timeout 5m -count 1 -run TestLoad
```

Also: the maxRPS config is removed from the AIMD scheduler, allowing the test
to find the max throughput even with a relatively low baseRPS.

prs.title: op-devstack: catch devtest late sub-test fails, and fix require.Eventually
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**

The `condition` of `require.Eventually` runs on its own go-routine.
This go-routine can interact with the test, but the test can exit before the routine exits.
This causes panics on the go-routine, which makes the whole test suite blow up with noisy errors.

So I fixed it in two ways:
- by wrapping the eventually-functions, and catching the panic in the condition, to then m

commits.message: op-devstack: catch devtest late sub-test fails, and fix require.Eventually

op-service: Fix length checks when parsing super roots (#15708)

* op-service: Fix length checks when parsing super roots.

* op-program: Fix unmarshalTransitionSate spelling

feat(devstack): propagate observability context (#15727)

This change introduces optional propagation of context through
environment variables.
This is helpful if a calling test runner (such as op-acceptor) generates
its own observability information, as the relationships are preserved
across processes.

op-program: Optimisations recommended by audit (#15709)

* op-program: Check block timestamp before retrieving receipts.

* op-program: Stop checking chains once a replacement block is inserted.

The replacement block means all blocks will be re-checked so checking further chains now is likely to be a waste as a valid response can't be trusted anyway.

* op-program: Skip HazardUnsafeFrontierChecks

op-program only ever progresses one block per chain at a time so the frontier checks performed by op-supervisor aren't required since the parent of any available initiating message block is always the agreed block or earlier and thus already cross-unsafe (and cross-safe and cross-finalized).

prs.title: replay: fix edge case of slot exec completing
prs.truncated_body: Fixes edge case where we complete the last slice of a slot, but we are still blocked on exec tile completing the last transactions. Then the ctx->flags will be `EXEC_FLAG_READY_NEW` which causes `handle_slice` to be called and the slice of another slot to be executed.  Without forks, this will cause the previous slot to never complete. With forks (although currently not supported) this will cause

prs.title: chore: Reclaim ingest throttle capacity after other failures
prs.truncated_body:
**Description**:

prs.title: Optimize: keep more exception info in UInt160.Parse and UInt256.Parse
prs.truncated_body:
Keep more exception info when UInt160.Parse and UInt256.Parse throw exception:

The current implementation of `UInt160.Parse` and `UInt256.Parse` use `TryParse`, but the exception message will be lost if throw `FormatException`.

Now `UInt160.TryParse` and `UInt256.TryParse` use `Parse`, the exception message not be lost.

prs.title: Modernize System files: Replace AddInstruction calls with helper methods and add comprehensive XML documentation
prs.truncated_body:
## Overview

This PR modernizes the System files in the MethodConvert layer by replacing legacy `AddInstruction(OpCode.XXX)` calls with modern helper methods and adding comprehensive XML documentation following Microsoft standards.

## Summary of Changes
